page.title: 02TRANSPORT (Railway - 2 of 3)
page.content: Ostensibly to decrease their losses on the Central Line in Essex, LTE, supported by the isolationist policies of its then controller, the GLC, imposed ever greater fare premiums. The inevitable result of what in the end amounted to gross extortion was to greatly distort the pattern of public transport in the area, with many commuters switching to road transport to inner area stations, resulting in considerable congestion and parking problems there. This was exactly what might have been expected, and gives weight to the belief widely held by regular travellers that the whole exercise was actually intended to drive away traffic to further LTE's desire to truncate the Central Line Service in Essex. {(continued)}
